sv:property.sv:value: This page lists some of Magnolia 2.1's more visible new features. For a complete list check the release notes and change log in jira.

Magnolia 2.0 comes with an innovative browser-based interface that works very much like your desktop software. Context sensitive menus let you choose between available actions, double click on items lets you edit them in place and many elements can be manipulated through drag & drop.
The new interface is very easy to use and reduces training to a minimum.
A screenshot of the magnolia admin interface

Release 2 includes a highly modified, adapted and customized version of the Kupu rich text editor. This makes it very easy to add links, bold or italic text, add numbered and unnumbered lists as well as a host of other features that you'd expect from a rich text editor. What you would not expect is the ability to define custom CSS tags, so that you can control exactly what your users do to their text. In addition, you can paste text directly from external sources (like your text editor), with automatic cleanup of the pasted text. This avoids many of the problems usually encountered when pasting text. Our implementation makes it very easy to configure Kupu to your needs, so that your users get exactly what they need - as so often, less is more.
Twice as Fast as Static Web Pages

The Magnolia 2.0 cache is serving pages more than twice as fast as a standard web server serves a static page. We cache pages compressed and uncompressed. This saves the time needed to compress a page, which in turn makes Magnolia faster than your good old static html pages.
Compression is configurable per MIME-type. This allows us for instance to leave images untouched (jpeg or gif are already compressed formats and further compression would slow things down).
You can also configure exactly which pages or site trees you wish to have cached. We use pattern matching on the request. Since images are served with an extra request, this allows us to cache a page but still have a dynamically generated image for each request - for example a page counter.

Magnolia 2.0 corresponds to the JSR-170 specification v0.14 as available through Apache's open source implementation, now called "Jackrabbit".
This implementation is significantly newer than the Magnolia 1.1 repository. Content can no longer be edited through the file system. Instead, our new configuration editor lets you manipulate repositories directly through the browser.

Magnolia 2.0 can be completely configured through the browser thanks to the new configuration editor. This eliminates the need to drop to the command line to configure your system. In addition, any content can now be activated between instances, including configuration, users, and roles.

One of the most requested feature for the new release has been the possibility to deploy Magnolia under one instance, which is now possible. The distribution still shows the two instance deployment but a description of how to install Magnolia on a single  instance shall be available soon.

Magnolia has been modularized and a new module interface has been included that allows you to add custom modules to Magnolia without touching the Magnolia code. As a start, we have defined the modules "admin interface" and "templating". The module interface allows:
  • repository sharing
  • local configuration
  • virtual URI mapping
Modules may have their own repositories or access shared repositories. To this end, a new repository loader lets you add module repositories dynamically. Modules can be configured completely through the new configuration editor in adminCentral.
obinary offers a wide range of services which will help users and developers to enable them a quick start and get an in-depth understanding of Magnolia.

If you are looking for a professional partner to plan and implement your new website based on Magnolia, ask the experts: obinary has been implementing dynamic websites for many years, and as the core developers of Magnolia, we know how to implement your requirements professionally. Just outline your ideas, and we will provide a cost estimate.

If you have specific needs that currently are not met by the Magnolia distribution, do not hesitate to ask us for a quote. We will be happy to provide our profound Magnolia expertise to realize any of your requirements.

You would like the quality of open source Magnolia combined with the best possible support? We meet your needs: as the core developers of Magnolia, we have the expertise regarding any questions on Magnolia. You will receive an acceptance feedback and a time estimate for each support request (regardless of the support level) within about one business day. We offer three different support levels at the following rates:
support level average reaction time fee Level 1 up to 5 business days 125€ per hour Level 2 up to 2 business days 175€ per hour Level 3 within 1 business day 200€ per hour
If you want to make use of our in-depth knowledge of magnolia, please contact us for our training offerings, either in-house or at obinary's premises.
If you are interested in our services, do not hesitate to contact us through our contact form or via marketing@obinary.com

If you provide services or implement projects with Magnolia, you should become a Magnolia partner. The goal of our partnerships is to develop a network of trusted and educated parties who share a common interest in advancing Magnolia. Partnerships are handled by Magnolia Organization.

You are looking for a reliable hosting partner for your Magnolia-CMS-based website? Obinary provides modern infrastructure, excellent know-how and expertise to meet your hosting needs.
Package contents
- Magnolia running on tomcat application server - ftp, sftp and ssh access (full access) - detailed statistics (sawmill) - 25 mail accounts (communigate pro) - webmail - daily backup - 3 support incidents per year included (email or phone)
Price: 750.00 € (per site and year)

We have set up an issue tracker. If you use Magnolia and find a bug, make sure its a bug (and not simply a configuration issue), check the issue tracker if it has been reported before, and add it if no one else has done so. A good bug description needs at least the following information:
  1. state what did you do to make things go wrong (this must be reproducable or else your bug will most likely be resolved with a "works for me" resolution). It should also include relevant background information like what system you are running on.
  2. state what you expect to happen
  3. state what happens instead
If you don't know if something is a bug or a configuration problem, check the mailing list archives for similar problems. If in doubt, post it on the list, and if the general agreement is that its a bug, go add it to the issue tracker.

We welcome your feedback. If you find that Magnolia lacks a feature, add an issue to our issue tracker. Mark your issue as "New feature" if it is something that does not currently exist, and as "improvement" if it exists but could be better. You have to create an account to be able to post issues, which has the advantage that you can receive feedback on th issues you have entered.
Magnolia Documentation is available at http://www.magnolia.info/en/community/documentation.html

If you want to develop web-sites with Magnolia, feel free to subscribe to the Magnolia user mailing list. Simply send an empty email. You can cancel at any time. To subscribe send a mail to: user-list-subscribe@magnolia.info To post send mails to: user-list@magnolia.info Please note the following:
  • We only accept plain text email on this list. If you are a windows user, by default that requirement will not be met. Please read "Configuring Mail Clients to Send Plain ASCII Text" to understand what is wrong with non-ASCII mail and what you can do about it. Even if that is the only thing you get out of visiting magnolia.info, it will be worth it.
  • If you have questions regarding installation issues, please be sure to check the archive first. Your mail might not  get answered if it has been answered many times before.
  • Trim your replies. That means do not simply hit "Reply" and start typing. Remove anything that is not directly relevant to your reply before you start typing. We all have the previous mail in our inbox, there is no need to have the whole thread copied into each reply.
  • Be concise - provide as much detail as necessary and as little as possible to state your case.
  • Keep in mind that all information and answers are provided by volunteers. Commercial support packages are available through partners of the Magnolia partner network.

Magnolia is the free, open source, J2EE deployable content management system software (CMS) developed by obinary. Magnolia uses the upcoming standard API for java content repositories (JCR) (JSR-170) to access its content. It has an easy to use web-browser interface, a clear API and a useful custom tag library for easy templating in JSP and Servlets.
"Please make sure you have filled out all fields marked with an asterisk"

This page shows how you can build your own custom form easily with Magnolia. To see this form in action, you need to edit the form properties and set your mail server and mail account. You find the form properties button on the main bar of this page, right next to page properties.
